content:
• Tuesday, October 16, 2012
  • FTNT

    More on Fortinet's Q3: Deferred revenue rose by $8.7M Q/Q to $340.1M, and billings rose 22% Y/Y...

    More on Fortinet's Q3: Deferred revenue rose by $8.7M Q/Q to $340.1M, and billings rose 22% Y/Y to $145M (above revenue of $136.3M). But the company is guiding for Q4 revenue of $142M-$146M and EPS of $0.15, below a consensus of $146.2M and $0.16. That's a major problem given shares were all but priced for perfection. The pending departure of well-respected CFO Ken Goldman to Yahoo is likely heightening concerns. FTNT -17.6% AH. FIRE -1%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • OSGB

    Overseas Shipholding (OSG -27.2%) shares took a huge hit today on concerns it has maxed out its...

    Overseas Shipholding (OSG -27.2%) shares took a huge hit today on concerns it has maxed out its lending facilities and could soon face a liquidity squeeze. Goldman Sachs and UBS reportedly are shopping around ~$100M in the tanker's revolver, looking to create a market for the debt before OSG needs to refinance $1.5B early next year. Shares are down by two-thirds YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • LLTC

    Linear Technology (NASDAQ:LLTC): FQ1 EPS of $0.45 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $335.1M (+2% Y/Y)...

    Linear Technology (NASDAQ:LLTC): FQ1 EPS of $0.45 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $335.1M (+2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • URI

    More on United Rentals (NYSE:URI) Q3 misses on its top line but beats on a per share basis. Net...

    More on United Rentals (NYSE:URI) Q3 misses on its top line but beats on a per share basis. Net profit rose 12% on double-digit revenue growth and better margins, helped by the equipment-rental company's recent acquisition of RSC Holdings. Rental revenue grew 74% to $1.05B. Shares +5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • ISRG

    More on Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q3 beats across the board on a 24% jump in total...

    More on Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q3 beats across the board on a 24% jump in total sales, but procedures came in below expectations, driven by challenging conditions in Europe and changes in prostate cancer detection and treatment. The company also warns of significant headwinds going forward. Shares -2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • HCP

    HCP agrees to acquire a portfolio of 133 senior housing communities from a JV between Emeritus...

    HCP agrees to acquire a portfolio of 133 senior housing communities from a JV between Emeritus (NYSE:ESC) and Blackstone Real Estate Partners (NYSE:BX) for $1.73B. ESC will continue to operate and improve the communities, and will purchase nine remaining properties from BX, for which HCP will provide secured debt financing of $52M. HCP -2.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT): Q3 EPS of $0.14 in-line. Revenue of $136.3M (+17% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT): Q3 EPS of $0.14 in-line. Revenue of $136.3M (+17% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • IBM

    IBM (NYSE:IBM): Q3 EPS of $3.62 in-line. Revenue of $24.75B (-5% Y/Y) misses by $630M. Expects...

    IBM (NYSE:IBM): Q3 EPS of $3.62 in-line. Revenue of $24.75B (-5% Y/Y) misses by $630M. Expects 2012 EPS of at least $15.10 vs. $15.14 consensus. Shares -3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 7 Comments
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q3 EPS of $4.46, beats by $0.94 may not compare to $3.50...

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q3 EPS of $4.46, beats by $0.94 may not compare to $3.50 estimates. Revenue of $538M (+24% Y/Y), beats by $3M. Shares -7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • MANH

    Manhattan Associates (NASDAQ:MANH): Q3 EPS of $0.75 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $95.8M (+11.9%...

    Manhattan Associates (NASDAQ:MANH): Q3 EPS of $0.75 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $95.8M (+11.9% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • IBKR

    Interactive Brokers (IEX:IBKR): Q3 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $319M (-17% Y/Y)...

    Interactive Brokers (IEX:IBKR): Q3 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $319M (-17% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares -2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • APOL

    Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ4 EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $996.5M (-11% Y/Y)...

    Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ4 EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $996.5M (-11% Y/Y) misses by $50M. Shares -9.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • CREE

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ1 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $315.8M (+17% Y/Y) in-line....

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ1 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $315.8M (+17% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZAZA

    ZaZa Energy (OTC:ZAZA -10.6%) raises its estimate of Eagle Ford reserves, but shares are sliding...

    ZaZa Energy (OTC:ZAZA -10.6%) raises its estimate of Eagle Ford reserves, but shares are sliding due to an announced private offering of convertible notes with a likely conversion premium of 15%-20% above the market price of the common stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • AXN

    Aoxing Pharmaceutical (AXN +7.4%) pops after the drug-maker reported a $15.9M net loss for FY12,...

    Aoxing Pharmaceutical (AXN +7.4%) pops after the drug-maker reported a $15.9M net loss for FY12, but total revenue rose 22% year over year to $8.13M. The revenue gain was largely due to a 33% increase in sales of the company's main product, Zhongtongan, which is now being marketed for gynecological and orthopedic applications, in addition to its core dental market. Overall, Zhongtongan accounted for 89% of the company's FY12 sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • LPIH

    Longwei Petroleum (LPH +6.2%) spikes to a new 52-week high after the company says it's commenced...

    Longwei Petroleum (LPH +6.2%) spikes to a new 52-week high after the company says it's commenced operations at its Huajie fuel storage depot in northern Shanxi Province. The company received its first shipment of petroleum to the new Huajie facility last week and began selling to customers on October 11.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • MCHP

    In spite of warning of a calendar Q3 revenue shortfall, Microchip (MCHP +1.6%) is trading higher...

    In spite of warning of a calendar Q3 revenue shortfall, Microchip (MCHP +1.6%) is trading higher today. Moreover, in spite of Microchip's status as an industry bellwether, chip stocks are among the day's big winners (SOXX +2.1%). Chip stocks have underperformed the Nasdaq over the last month, leading some bad news to be priced in. Also, Jefferies' comments about iPhone 5 builds seem to be giving a lift to Apple suppliers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -6.2%) has made new lows again today after issuing a PR repeating last...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -6.2%) has made new lows again today after issuing a PR repeating last week's disclosure that the company can't forecast when it will be able to file its FQ2 (Aug. quarter) 10-Q. OCZ, which is posting big losses and recently said it had to tap a credit facility, is now trading at 0.19x estimated FY13 (ends Feb. '13) sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • LYB

    LyondellBasell (LYB +5.7%) extends yesterday's gains sparked by a Barron's report that the hedge...

    LyondellBasell (LYB +5.7%) extends yesterday's gains sparked by a Barron's report that the hedge fund favorite was named as one of the chemical companies with most upside potential. But chemical names are strong across the board today, perhaps from speculation that a regulatory ruling could open up a move to an MLP structure: WLK +7.7%, DOW +5.3%, HUN +3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • CLMT

    Calumet Specialty Products (CLMT +8.5%) trades higher after it bumps up its quarterly cash...

    Calumet Specialty Products (CLMT +8.5%) trades higher after it bumps up its quarterly cash distribution to $0.62 per unit, an increase of 5.1% over its previous quarterly distribution.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 6 Comments
  • HES

    Hess (HES +3.8%) shares are strong on Murphy Oil's (MUR +8.8%) move to spin off its U.S....

    Hess (HES +3.8%) shares are strong on Murphy Oil's (MUR +8.8%) move to spin off its U.S. fuel-making business into a new company. Conoco used a similar strategy earlier this year when it spun off its fuels, petrochemicals and pipeline businesses into Phillips 66. HES operates in two segments - exploration and production, and marketing and refining - making it a potential candidate for a spinoff.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • BLRX

    BioLineRx (BLRX +5.9%) trades higher after saying it's completed pre-clinical development of its...

    BioLineRx (BLRX +5.9%) trades higher after saying it's completed pre-clinical development of its BL-8020 drug candidate, an oral treatment for Hepatitis C. The company plans to initiate a Phase I/II safety and efficacy study in Europe starting early next year and is expecting to receive regulatory approvals from the appropriate authorities by year's end.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper (JNPR +3.8%) outperforms ahead of its Oct. 23 Q3 report after Morgan Stanley predicts Q4...

    Juniper (JNPR +3.8%) outperforms ahead of its Oct. 23 Q3 report after Morgan Stanley predicts Q4 guidance will be strong: the firm expects Verizon will continue deploying Juniper's costly PTX Ethernet switches and T4000 routers, and that AT&T will buy more MX-series edge routers (previous). Verizon and AT&T's muted capex (particularly for wireline networks) has dinged the shares of many telecom equipment names. MKM is taking a more guarded view of Juniper, predicting Q4 guidance will be light due to weak industry capex.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • NOOF

    Midday top 10 gainers: NOOF +54%. DSTI +37%. INVE +31%. BCOM +17%. PAMT +16%. OTC:PRXI +16%. TRT...

    Midday top 10 gainers: NOOF +54%. DSTI +37%. INVE +31%. BCOM +17%. PAMT +16%. OTC:PRXI +16%. TRT +16.%. APPY +13%. ARL +12%. RLGT +11%. Top 10 Losers: AONE -75%. RATE -24%. OSG -22%. KFS -19%. ISIS -18%. VRML -18%. CLWR -15%. OCZ -11%. CMRE -11%. VIMC -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +8%) jumps after signing an MOU with Indeonesia's PJB Services to develop...

    First Solar (FSLR +8%) jumps after signing an MOU with Indeonesia's PJB Services to develop 100MW worth of solar plants. First Solar, whose stabilizing financial position has much to do with its newfound emphasis on utility-scale solar projects relative to regular module sales, says the MOU is its first in Indonesia. (PR) (other recent deals: I, II, III)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 4 Comments
  • KR

    Kroger (KR +4.3%) raises its long-term EPS estimates, saying it now expects profits to grow at a...

    Kroger (KR +4.3%) raises its long-term EPS estimates, saying it now expects profits to grow at a 8%-11% clip, up from prior guidance of 6%-8%. Mobile and digital channels as well as new store formats are expected to help boost results. The company also approved a $500M share repurchase program to replace an existing program that still had $340M remaining. (Previous: Jefferies ups to Buy)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • ACHN

    Achillion (ACHN +4.6%) gains on a price target increase to $17 from $12 at Deutsche Bank. The...

    Achillion (ACHN +4.6%) gains on a price target increase to $17 from $12 at Deutsche Bank. The firm says liver abstracts from Bristol-Myers (BMY +0.6%) and Abbott (ABT +0.1%) bode well for the future success of ACHN's two drug combo regimens for the treatment of hepatitus C virus. The firm made similar comments yesterday about Gilead (GILD +1.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • HP

    Helmerich & Payne (HP +2.5%) moves up on RBC Capital's upgrade and raised target price...

    Helmerich & Payne (HP +2.5%) moves up on RBC Capital's upgrade and raised target price (to $58 from $54) based on early indications that 2013 E&P capex budgets will gain ~10%-20% Y/Y. RBC also believes rig quality, well capitalized customer base and contract visibility gives HP the best relative position among land drillers in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • LPL

    LCD panel makers LG Display (LPL +6.1%) and AU Optronics (AUO +9.4%) jump after getting upgraded...

    LCD panel makers LG Display (LPL +6.1%) and AU Optronics (AUO +9.4%) jump after getting upgraded all the way to Outperform from Sell by Credit Agricole. Both companies are exposed to a weak TV market, but are also benefiting from their supplier relationships with Apple - LG provides in-cell touch panels for the iPhone 5, and both LG and AU are reportedly providing LCD panels for the iPad Mini.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • MUR

    Murphy Oil's (MUR +7.8%) move to spin off its U.S. fuel-making and distribution business into a...

    Murphy Oil's (MUR +7.8%) move to spin off its U.S. fuel-making and distribution business into a new company could unlock up $5/share in trapped enterprise value, Simmons analysts say, and “could be a sign for more aggressive moves to continue to improve the valuation in shares (more aggressive divestments, for example)." Chalk up at least one item, and maybe two, on Dan Loeb's wish list.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -16%) drops after an FDA panel posts briefing documents for its...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -16%) drops after an FDA panel posts briefing documents for its Hypercholesterolemia treatment Kynamro. The briefing shows an "unexpected" level of concern because drug, which heads before a panel of non-FDA experts Thursday charged with recommending approval, has shown to cause an increase in cancers in rat studies. Additionally, it's also been attributed to fat buildup in the liver that can lead to long-term damage.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • TOT

    Total (TOT +2.4%) says it is looking to sell TIGF, its natural gas pipeline operator in...

    Total (TOT +2.4%) says it is looking to sell TIGF, its natural gas pipeline operator in southwest France, as part of its strategy to divest $15B-$20B in assets over the next two years and restructure its refining and chemicals business to raise cash for new oil and gas extraction projects. TOT also signs a $200M deal with Schlumberger's (NYSE:SLB) Framo unit for a pumping system in Angola.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • NVLN

    Aegerion (AEGR +6.6%) continues its uptrend, with the stock close to breaking out of a trading...

    Aegerion (AEGR +6.6%) continues its uptrend, with the stock close to breaking out of a trading range that has persisted since 2011. The stock popped yesterday in reaction to an FDA staff report on its cholesterol drug lomitapide, and has ramped up nearly 35% since Friday in anticipation of its release.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • GFI

    Gold Fields (GFI +1.9%) issues a "final ultimatum" that it will fire 15K employees unless they...

    Gold Fields (GFI +1.9%) issues a "final ultimatum" that it will fire 15K employees unless they end their strike by Thursday. GFI says it has lost 65K troy oz. gold output and 1.2B rand ($136M) in revenue due to the strike that is now being embraced by 23,500 of its workers.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • CHTR

    Entropic (ENTR +2.8%) gains after receiving an upgrade to Buy from D.A. Davidson. The firm...

    Entropic (ENTR +2.8%) gains after receiving an upgrade to Buy from D.A. Davidson. The firm believes Entropic's set-top box chips will be often used in digital-to-analog adapters to be deployed by Time Warner Cable (TWC) as it migrates to an all-digital network. DA also believes TWC may be able to finish its all-digital migration ahead of its 5-year target.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +2.5%) rallies after Stifel starts coverage with a Buy and $5 PT, while touting...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +2.5%) rallies after Stifel starts coverage with a Buy and $5 PT, while touting Glu's credentials as a mobile gaming pure-play. Glu plummeted last week on news and commentary regarding the performance of recent game launches, before rebounding some thanks to insider purchases from a VC investor.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • MBOT

    StemCells (STEM +3.6%) moves higher today after launching four new human neural stem cell kits...

    StemCells (STEM +3.6%) moves higher today after launching four new human neural stem cell kits under its SC Proven brand for use in neuroscience research. Each kit will contain high purity, multi-potent neural stem cells derived from a different area of the human central nervous system, and will provide researchers with a platform with which to perform a broad range of assays and tests.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • MNK

    Shares of Questcor (QCOR +6.7% are rallying this morning after James Flynn of Deerfield...

    Shares of Questcor (QCOR +6.7% are rallying this morning after James Flynn of Deerfield Management reported a 5.82% passive stake in the company late yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 3 Comments
  • PPP

    Primero Mining (PPP +1.5%) says it will expand its San Dimas gold and silver mine in Mexico to...

    Primero Mining (PPP +1.5%) says it will expand its San Dimas gold and silver mine in Mexico to 2,500 metric tons/day, spending a total of $14.4M. Construction of the mine and mill expansion will begin immediately, with estimated completion during Q1 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • SA

    Seabridge Gold (SA +1.5%) says assay results at its Courageous Lake gold project in the...

    Seabridge Gold (SA +1.5%) says assay results at its Courageous Lake gold project in the Northwest Territories have “substantially” increased the size of the high-grade discovery. The Walsh Lake zone now has a strike length of nearly 900 meters; results from another 10 holes drilled in this year's program are expected over the next several weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 3 Comments
  • PNC

    PNC Financial dives 4.3% following this morning's headline beat on earnings. The bank reported...

    PNC Financial dives 4.3% following this morning's headline beat on earnings. The bank reported total loan growth of 1% Q/Q, with net interest margin declining 26 basis points to 3.82%. Mortgage banking is a bright spot, contributing $36M to the bottom line after accounting for a $213M loss in Q2. Loan loss reserve release adds $28M to profits. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • DPZ

    Shares of Domino's Pizza (DPZ +7.8%) rally after the company reported strong Q3 numbers (I, II)....

    Shares of Domino's Pizza (DPZ +7.8%) rally after the company reported strong Q3 numbers (I, II). Management continues to draw praise for its Goldilocks approach to international expansion as the company has now extended its impressive streak of only missing profit estimates once since 2007.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • DDC

    In its Q3 production update, Harry Winston (HWD -1.9%) says its Diavik diamond mine produced...

    In its Q3 production update, Harry Winston (HWD -1.9%) says its Diavik diamond mine produced 1.93M carats from 520K metric tons of ore processed. Production was unchanged from a year ago, but the amount of ore processed fell 19%. HWD says its full-year production target is now ~7.4M carats, down from its previous view of 8.3M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • ARQL

    ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) +3.7% premarket after reaching an agreement with the FDA to design a...

    ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) +3.7% premarket after reaching an agreement with the FDA to design a Phase-3 trial of its drug tivantinib in patients with hepatocellular carcinoma, a type of liver cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • HCA

    HCA (NYSE:HCA) intends to declare special dividend of $2.50/share. Shares +2.8% premarket. (PR)

    HCA (NYSE:HCA) intends to declare special dividend of $2.50/share. Shares +2.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • NOOF

    Larry Flynt is adding to his adult entertainment empire, agreeing to acquire pay-per-view movie...

    Larry Flynt is adding to his adult entertainment empire, agreeing to acquire pay-per-view movie distributor New Frontier Media (NASDAQ:NOOF) for ~$33M. The $2.02/share offer is a ~55% premium to yesterday's closing price; shares +53.8% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Market preview: Stocks are set for a second day of gains this week as Spain says it may ask for...

    Market preview: Stocks are set for a second day of gains this week as Spain says it may ask for a credit line rather than an actual loan and heavy hitters such as Goldman Sachs (+0.3%) follow Citigroup in besting Wall St's finest in their earnings reports. Citigroup (-1.7%), of course, is grabbing the attention following the resignation of CEO Vikram Pandit, who presided over an 89% loss in shares. S&P benchmark futures +0.5%. Later: NAHB Housing Market Index, Fed's Sarah Bloom Raskin
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • NOOF

    Premarket gainers: NOOF +54%. THLD +12%. MUR +8%. AEGR +7%. JOEZ +7%. CUR +7%. DPZ +6%.Losers:...

    Premarket gainers: NOOF +54%. THLD +12%. MUR +8%. AEGR +7%. JOEZ +7%. CUR +7%. DPZ +6%.
    Losers: RATE -26%. ISIS -20%. CLWR -19%. CMRE -10%. WAC -5%. GWW -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • BAGL

    Einstein Noah Restaurants (NASDAQ:BAGL) falls 2.8% premarket after announcing it will explore a...

    Einstein Noah Restaurants (NASDAQ:BAGL) falls 2.8% premarket after announcing it will explore a possible business combination or sale of the company as well as a possible recapitalization. In addition, the restaurant operator warns it sees Q3 revenue coming in it around $105.5M, below the consensus estimate of $108.7M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • BPI

    Education stocks are on watch after Bridgepoint Education reveals it's under investigation by...

    Education stocks are on watch after Bridgepoint Education reveals it's under investigation by the DOJ. The sector could take a hit with an increasing focus on the practice of companies of tying compensation to recruiting levels. Lawmakers (and taxpayers) are less than thrilled with the prevailing quantity over quality sentiment in the sector. BPI -13.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM | 2 Comments
  • MTEM

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) jumps 13.5% after the FDA reaches an agreement for the Phase...

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) jumps 13.5% after the FDA reaches an agreement for the Phase III trial of TH-302 for the treatment of pancreatic cancer. The study will be conducted by Germany's Merck, Threshold's partner in the development of TH-302. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • HCA

    HCA (NYSE:HCA): Q3 EPS of $0.78 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $8.06B misses by $840M. Shares -1%...

    HCA (NYSE:HCA): Q3 EPS of $0.78 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $8.06B misses by $840M. Shares -1% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE) officially files for bankruptcy protection. The electric car battery maker...

    A123 Systems (AONE) officially files for bankruptcy protection. The electric car battery maker warned last night it might file for bankruptcy after defaulting on a loan payment. It remains to be seen how the filing affects A123's financing deal with China's Wanxiang Group. Shares -50% to $0.12.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM | 17 Comments
  • FOSL

    Shares of Fossil (NASDAQ:FOSL) add 3.2% in premarket trading after Citi ups its rating on the...

    Shares of Fossil (NASDAQ:FOSL) add 3.2% in premarket trading after Citi ups its rating on the retailer to Buy with a lush $100 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • MUR

    Murphy Oil (NYSE:MUR) declares special dividend of $2.50/share. For shareholders of record Nov...

    Murphy Oil (NYSE:MUR) declares special dividend of $2.50/share. For shareholders of record Nov 16. Payable Dec 03. Ex-div date Nov 14. The company has approved to repurchase upto $1B shares. Shares +6.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • DPZ

    More on Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ): Same-store sales up 3.3% Y/Y in the U.S. and 5% globally....

    More on Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ): Same-store sales up 3.3% Y/Y in the U.S. and 5% globally. Total store count up 116 to 10,040 with international growth outpacing domestic by 13 to 1. Shares +3.3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • C

    More on the Pandit resignation: "Mr. Pandit has told colleagues that he intends to stay for...

    More on the Pandit resignation: "Mr. Pandit has told colleagues that he intends to stay for several years," reads a WSJ story from two months ago on Citigroup's (NYSE:C) succession planning. The company managed to put out yesterday's earnings release and conference call (led by Pandit) without hint of what it knew was in the works. Why again is this a company worth owning? Shares -2.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM | 3 Comments
  • IOC

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) +5.8% premarket on reports the company's JV is planning on selling half of...

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) +5.8% premarket on reports the company's JV is planning on selling half of two gas fields it owns in Papua New Guinea to the government and local owners, a move that may unlock development of a new $6B-plus export project. IOC also enters into a $100M secured term loan facility with BNP Paribas and other banks.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • FRX

    More on Forest Laboratories (FRX -3%) FQ2: net profit plunges to $20.8M from $249.8M last year, with the the patent expiration for Lexapro continuing to hurt.
